item.title: Lead story designer on the first Witcher game just rolled credits on a full playthrough, and you can watch the whole thing on YouTube
item.content:encoded: 26 episodes later, Artur Ganszyniec's let's play series is finally over.

item.title: Blizzard isn't going to let World of Warcraft players suffer from outdated character customization for long, but it's going to take some time to fix
item.content:encoded: The team is very aware that there's a bias towards newer playable races.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows is still getting updates, and it just added manual jumping to the delight of many a parkour enthusiast: 'I picked a good time to reinstall'
item.content:encoded: It's like jumping, but done manually.

item.title: NetEase breaks up with another western studio, but it refuses to die and instead 'remains motivated and deeply committed to the incredible game we’re building'
item.content:encoded: But if you happen to have several million dollars lying around, the devs would like to speak to you.

item.title: Many consumer electronics manufacturers 'will go bankrupt or exit product lines' by the end of 2026 due to the AI memory crisis, Phison CEO reportedly says
item.content:encoded: This mess is going to get a lot worse before it gets better.

item.title: I applaud this gacha game for ditching anime characters for puppets, but it still can't escape the pitfalls of a post-Genshin Impact world
item.content:encoded: I want to live in a world where Sea of Remnants is just an RPG with no caveats.

item.title: 'This marks a significant step towards addressing anticompetitive behaviors': Following a complaint from Opera, antitrust regulator launches an investigation into Microsoft Edge
item.content:encoded: It's not over, it's just beginning.

item.title: When Overwatch said it was returning to the story, I did not expect its most genius decision: Reworking maps for the fun of it
item.content:encoded: Fresh spins on old favourites.

item.title: Today I learned Motorola was once developing a password pill that turns your body into an authentication token: 'We have demoed this working and authenticating a phone'
item.content:encoded: This was part of Motorola's goal to 'fix' the "mechanical mismatch between humans and electronics."

item.title: Burglin' Gnomes is the next great friend-slop game that everyone with a PC and at least one other friend should check out
item.content:encoded: Let's go, friend-slop.

item.title: The best King's Field-likes on PC
item.content:encoded: From software, with love.

item.title: Google has published a list of ways AI is currently being used by threat actors to more efficiently hack you
item.content:encoded: Some of it is reportedly from 'government-backed' entities, too.

item.title: You could win a $100 Steam gift card by sending us clips of your best, funniest, and wildest gaming moments!
item.content:encoded: PC Gamer's newest feature is all about you.

item.title: Total War: Warhammer 3's first character pack stars an all-new legendary lord that puts the 'cat' in Grand Cathay
item.content:encoded: Bhashiva the White Tiger will arrive some time during "a late‑Spring release window."

item.title: I'm sad Deadlock is 'just' a MOBA—not because I don't like them, but because I'm in love with Valve's lore and characters enough to want any other game instead
item.content:encoded: An RPG, an MMO, an FPS—I'll take anything, man.

item.title: I thought Fishing Shop Simulator was a joke after I saw mechs in ancient Rome, but after two hours with its demo, I'm hooked
item.content:encoded: Build your own fishmongers in post-war ancient sci-fi Rome.

item.title: You don't need G Hub running to save or switch between the Logitech G Pro X2 Superstrike's settings
item.content:encoded: Though you have to sacrifice one your very few mouse buttons.

item.title: Ayaneo celebrates the Chinese New Year with the launch of a new customer service improvement plan, with US-based repair facilities currently being tested
item.content:encoded: It also warns that some current products may be pulled from sale due to the escalating memory crisis.

item.title: PC Gamer Clips
item.content:encoded: PC Gamer Clips

item.title: Surprise! Baldur's Gate 3 got a fresh patch. Unsurprise! It's vanishingly small, but at least it repairs some corrupted saves
item.content:encoded: It's a treat just to see you in my newsfeed again, BG3.

item.title: Bloomberg claims 'rampant AI demand for memory' is forcing Sony to consider pushing back the launch of its next-gen PlayStation as far back as 2029
item.content:encoded: A plague on all our computing houses.

item.title: A human software engineer rejected an AI agent's code change request, only for the AI agent to retaliate by publishing an 'angry' blog about him
item.content:encoded: Poison ap-pen-d.

item.title: Overwatch tier list for Season 1 Conquest
item.content:encoded: Which characters rule Season 1?

item.title: Yakuza Kiwami 3's blunders have made it the worst-reviewed game in the series on Steam: 'Creatively bankrupt doesn't even begin to describe the current state of RGG'
item.content:encoded: "Even ignoring the casting of someone who sexually assaulted others on camera, this is an inferior remake."

item.title: Crimson Desert is made by the devs of MMO Black Desert, but it won't have any non-preorder microtransactions on launch: 'This is the premium experience, that is the transaction'
item.content:encoded: Nary a cash shop in sight.

item.title: Intel is still committed to evolving its Xe graphics architecture, though it's only talking about AI data centers right now
item.content:encoded: What this means for gaming GPUs isn't clear, unfortunately.

item.title: Shutaro Iida, Konami veteran and programmer for the Castlevania and Metal Gear series credited as 'Curry The Kid', has died at the age of 52
item.content:encoded: Iida died on February 10

item.title: I'm a Wizard, But I Dig combines my love of Minecraft strip-mining, casting spells, and little blob creatures in one big magical mining sim
item.content:encoded: Diggy diggy hole.

item.title: 'It's my favorite feature': Dawn of War 4 is adding a way to multi-attack enemies using a dragbox
item.content:encoded: "Everyone knows you can multi-select units via rectangle with left mouse button, but in Dawn of War 4 you can multi-attack enemies."

item.title: This space MMO was coded by AI, is played by AI, and all us meatbags can do is watch them
item.content:encoded: SpaceMolt is a vibe-coded "living universe" where AI agents face off against one another.

item.title: Acer Nitro V15 gaming laptop review
item.content:encoded: Due to unforeseen market forces, we've travelled back in time.

item.title: 'No platform gets a free pass': UK government's Online Safety Act rules extending to chatbots after Grok fallout
item.content:encoded: This is alongside plans to enforce age restrictions and tackle 'harmful' infinite scroll designs.

item.title: Intel has now rolled out XeSS 3 multi-frame generation to every Arc-powered GPU, after its first foray only on Panther Lake
item.content:encoded: Alchemist and Battlemage, integrated and discrete, they're all getting the AI performance booster.

item.title: How to get and use the Fancy Bow in Mewgenics
item.content:encoded: Does Tink's mysterious Fancy Bow have a purpose?

item.title: Old school hard drives are getting more reliable according to a new survey but good luck buying one later this year thanks to AI demand
item.content:encoded: 1.36% overall HDD failure rate reported as one drive maker says it's sold out for 2026.

item.title: The Dawn of War 4 team isn't worried about Total War: Warhammer 40k: 'This is definitely a case of holy s***, it's two cakes'
item.content:encoded: "It's a good time to be a Warhammer fan."

item.title: Direct Asus and Acer gaming PC sales blocked in Germany due to lawsuit from Finnish phone manufacturer Nokia
item.content:encoded: Auf wiedersehen.

item.title: 'Our team is still fully committed and working hard on 2XKO' says Riot as it announces two new characters days after mass layoff announcement
item.content:encoded: Akali and Senna are next to join the roster.

item.title: Artist scales retro speaker up to ridiculous proportions: 'Is this a really stupid project? Yes'
item.content:encoded: It's about time someone brought back the look.

item.title: YouTuber hosts battle royale between 4 wizards from 4 different TTRPG systems—and boy does it end almost immediately, despite the DM's best efforts
item.content:encoded: Pity the D&D wizard, who walked out of cover, cast Magic Missile on a goblin, and then got disintegrated.

item.title: Konami got the main thing right with Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol. 2, but it could and should have offered so much more
item.content:encoded: A whole chunk of the series' history remains locked on PSP.

item.title: Discord will decide which servers to age-gate 'with a combination of automated detection with AI validation and human review'
item.content:encoded: What could possibly go wrong?

item.title: The modder who saved Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 1 has been showing off a treasure trove of material from the canceled version of Bloodlines 2
item.content:encoded: I don't know if anyone on this earth loves VtMB as much as Wesp5.

item.title: The cozy game boom is the clearest trend on Steam over five years of data
item.content:encoded: GameDiscoverCo's data shows the word "cozy" being used in capsule descriptions more and more frequently.

item.title: We'll be able to hit zombies with meat in singleplayer medieval survival sim God Save Birmingham
item.content:encoded: The King can look after himself.

item.title: The best Smash Bros.-like on Steam just added a character who can shop for items and go fishing in the middle of a match, in case you thought fighting games were too one-note
item.content:encoded: Fin-ish him.

item.title: Five new Steam games you probably missed (February 16, 2026)
item.content:encoded: Sorting through every new game on Steam so you don't have to.

item.title: Solid Snake is coming to Rainbow Six Siege in March with David Hayter reprising the role, and a new trailer shows Snake and stealth game rival Sam Fisher finally squashing the beef
item.content:encoded: New playlists, weapons, map updates, and yes, Solid Snake, await.

item.title: Hideki Sato, father of the Sega Dreamcast, Saturn, Genesis, and more, has died
item.content:encoded: Sato's career in games began in the 1970s.

item.title: Silent Hill 2 Remake dev Bloober Team's Valentine's Day reveal turned out to be Layers of Fear 3
item.content:encoded: Sorry if you were expecting Cronos 2.
